decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Life from the Loam to continuously recycle lands like Wasteland and punishing lands and control the opponent's resources. It also includes various control elements like Chalice of the Void and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck can also generate value through cards like Dark Confidant and Knight of the Reliquary. Finally, it includes a combo finish with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 indestructible creature.

The deck is focused on quickly ramping up mana using lands like Ancient Tomb and Cloudpost, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Lodestone Golem and The Abyss. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Maze of Ith and Pithing Needle, while also having powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck has a mix of aggro elements with powerful mana acceleration in order to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Cloudpost and Glimmerpost, allowing for early plays of powerful and expensive colorless creatures and planeswalkers like Emrakul and Karn Liberated. It also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Sphere of Resistance to slow down opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its large threats and constant mana advantage, while also being able to disrupt their game plan with cards like Warping Wail. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and outpace opponents in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a lethal combination of creatures and pump spells to deal 10 poison damage to the opponent. It utilizes efficient creatures with infect like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, as well as powerful pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to close out the game in just a few turns. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, ensuring a fast and consistent win. Additionally, it features card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces for the combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Punishing Fire, while utilizing Life from the Loam to recur lands and maintain resource advantage. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's plans, while Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library provide card advantage. The deck also includes creatures like Knight of the Reliquary for utility and Gaddock Teeg to hinder spells. Liliana of the Veil helps control the board, making it difficult for opponents to develop their game plan. It aims to grind out opponents over time and out value them with its versatile control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through manipulation of the opponent's plays and the top of the library. By utilizing powerful control cards like Counterbalance, Swords to Plowshares, and Terminus, as well as card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence. The use of cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sensei's Divining Top allows for consistent card selection and manipulation, ensuring that the control player always has the answers they need to stay ahead in the game.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Matter Reshaper. It also disrupts the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck utilizes powerful lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to ramp into its big threats early on. Additionally, it has utility cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Warping Wail to handle various situations. The deck's goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's plans, and close out the game efficiently.

The main concept of this Elves combo deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly by utilizing cards such as Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, then casting powerful spells like Natural Order to search for and put into play game-ending creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith help to dig for key combo pieces while also maintaining card advantage. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Reclamation Sage to help deal with opposing strategies. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive combo finish.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through efficient spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, then using card draw and manipulation spells to dig for combo pieces. Once the pieces are in hand, the deck can use cards like Infernal Tutor and Ad Nauseam to go off and win the game with a massive Tendrils of Agony. The deck also utilizes Past in Flames to recast key spells from the graveyard and continue the storm combo. The deck aims to win in a single explosive turn before the opponent can react.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of removal, counter spells, and hand disruption while efficiently deploying threats that can take over the game. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, along with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis, this deck aims to control the game until it can close out the game with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. It's a versatile and adaptable deck that can handle a variety of threats and strategies.

The primary goal of this deck is to utilize various spells such as Exhume, Animate Dead, and Reanimate to quickly bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Iona, and Elesh Norn onto the battlefield from the graveyard. The deck also utilizes Show and Tell to cheat these creatures into play, bypassing traditional casting costs. With a mix of card draw, disruption, and combo pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats early in the game. The deck also includes a small amount of interaction with cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect its game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish early board presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent's life total and control the board through cheap removal and countermagic, ultimately ending the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis and Bedlam Reveler provides additional threats and card advantage, helping to maintain pressure on the opponent in the mid to late game.
